content.title: English
content.description: I learned a lot of English from the internet. I always liked the idea of an universal language and it is the closest we have. Most of my grammar I learned from school and most of my vocabulary comes from books and TV-programs.

content.title: Dutch
content.description: My native language. I have been speaking it since I was around two.

content.title: Project management
content.description: I learned how to handle projects by handling projects. The first big project I worked on was this resume and I made a lot of mistakes. But I have improved with every project. I learned good practices at school, like documenting what you want to make.

content.title: Back-end web
content.description: I'm quite new at back-end programming. I first used PHP to setup dynamic content for this website. Later, when choosing a webhost, I decided to rebuild the dynamic content system with Node. While doing this I did a lot of other programming to get everything working properly.

content.title: Databases
content.description: I first used a database for this project. When working with Node, I decided to use Mongo, as it works easier with Javascript. In school I learned all about SQL and some database normalization.

content.title: Design
content.description: As a kid I was more into creative things. The problem was that I couldn't really paint, or draw. I later picked up a hobby of making illustrations in _Paint.net_, which I posted to [Google+](https://plus.google.com/+LucasvanOsenbruggen). When I found Adobe Illustrator I liked it more because of the exact placements and preserving of resolution. I ended up with some stuff I still actually like. I abandoned the hobby when I started with the design of websites. The interactiveness with which I could create was more interesting to me.

content.title: Programming
content.description: I started programming in websites with _Javascript_. When I had learned that, it was easier to learn other languages. A lot of practices are shared between languages. I later spent some time learning _Python_. Although I didn't really have a purpose for it, I learned a lot about programming in general _(for example 1.1 + 2.2 != 3.3)_. I also took a [typing course](https://www.typing.com/student/verify#45709563-59376030) online for more efficiency.
